According to the problem, the height of point C is given by h_C = R - R*cos37° = 0.08m.
After being thrown from point B, the slider undergoes projectile motion: h - h_C = 1/2 g t^2.
At time t = 0.3s, the velocity of object B is v_B = 3m/s.
The vertical velocity when flying to point C is v_y = g t = 3m/s.
Therefore, tan α = v_y/v_B = 1, so the angle between the velocity and the horizontal direction when it reaches point C is 45°.
